sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Reports of new strikes in Kyiv and paratroopers in Kharkiv as Russian forces escalate their attack on Ukraine's urban areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The country's capital enters combat mode as residents and troops prepare the city for war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And U.S. President Joe Biden sends a warning to Vladimir Putin, vowing freedom will triumph over tyranny.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian soldiers patrol the streets of Kyiv at night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As locals hunkered down in their shelters and basements fearing the worst, there were reports of strikes in residential areas of the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russian forces have escalated their attacks on urban areas, warning of what they called high-precision strikes on strategic targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A Russian convoy headed towards Kyiv appears to have slowed down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's thought the long line of vehicles may be a siege caravan with enough armoury to surround the capital and cut it off.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: An earlier strike on Kyiv's television tower would appear to support that idea, cutting the capital's communications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But that's not so easy these days with internet and satellite phones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The shelling of Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv, has been described by President Zelensky as a war crime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The International Court of Justice, the principal judicial organ of the United Nations, has confirmed it will halt hearings next week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian leader, who had a standing ovation during his address to the European Parliament yesterday, said his country is fighting for survival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A second round of peace talks are due later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky has one demand. As for dialogue, I think yes, but stop bombarding people first and start negotiating afterwards. Meanwhile, everywhere in Ukraine, resistance is being organized. Volunteers and residents are mobilizing to defend their country in whatever way they can and at all costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian capital is bracing for war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As Russian troops are closing in, checkpoints and barricades are everywhere in and around the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Alongside the national army are scores of volunteers enrolling with the Territorial Defence Forces, the reserve troops of the Ukrainian Armed Forces coming from all fields of life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Alexander is a member of parliament, one of several, enrolled in a battalion based here in the center of Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: ALEXANDER KOLASHNIKOV, Ukrainian Parliamentary Leader, Kiev, Ukraine Ukrainian parliamentarism is not the place where you should only vote, but you also should defend it with a rifle in your hands, your right to vote and to have democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is Kolashnikov, and if Russians will enter the city, I will do my best.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If Russian tanks venture to the city center, this slogan, paraphrasing Ukrainian soldiers on a small island on the Black Sea when asked to surrender by a Russian warship, is here to warn them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Right now, this is exactly what all Ukrainians are saying to Russians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Go to hell. leave us alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, I would use two words to describe the sentiment here. It's fear and determination. Fear because indeed the pictures we see of the convoys arriving to Kyiv are very very alarming for the population here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Many have sent their relatives to safer parts of Ukraine, although now who knows what is a safe spot in Ukraine given the number of bombings and explosions that we've heard of throughout the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Now, for those who are staying in Kyiv, well, some of them are literally living in shelters, others who stayed at home are mobilizing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In general, the population who is still in Kyiv is completely mobilized and ready to fight alongside the Ukrainian army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He may not have expected to, but U.S. President Joe Biden found himself delivering his first State of the Union address in the spirit of being a wartime president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Of course, the US economy was there in various policies, including to check inflation and raise the minimum wage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the global crisis dominated the speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Putin's latest attack on Ukraine was premeditated and totally unprovoked.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He rejected repeated, repeated efforts at diplomacy. He thought the West and NATO wouldn't respond. He thought he could divide us at home in this chamber in this nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He thought he could divide us in Europe as well. But Putin was wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He thought he could divide us in Europe as well, but Putin was wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: While applauding the bravery of Ukraine, as the country's ambassador to the U.S. looked on, he stressed he was going to check Russian aggression and go after Russia's wealthy oligarchs, whose wealth helped support the Russian economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Department of Justice is assembling a dedicated task force to go after the crimes of the Russian oligarchs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We're joining with European allies to find and seize their yachts, their luxury apartments, their private jets. We're coming for you, ill-begotten gangs, and tonight I'm announcing that we will join our allies in closing off American airspace to all Russian flights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: God bless you all, and may God protect our troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thank you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Go get him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Biden's popularity polls hover around 40%, and his address was his chance to get voters on his side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: His message was that the US is emerging out of the pandemic and to convey a sense of economic confidence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But like his audience, no one could have anticipated that emergence would come during a war in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine has set in motion a huge wave of human movement as desperate families attempt to flee the missiles and bombs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: People are leaving with the clothes on their back and whatever they can carry or pack into cars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN says so far more than 660,000 people are on the move, mainly women and children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The main destination is neighbouring Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the midst of the chaos, some have claimed Ukrainians are being given priority over non-European residents when it comes to boarding trains and buses. But Poland has denied any discrimination and says it's taken in over 300,000 people from 125 nationalities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Romania is another destination for those who want to get out, and it's not hard to understand why they're so desperate to leave. There are shelters and farms each day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: So the transportation stops, food furnished from supermarkets, no money in the ATM, people trying to get rid of the city, but the terrain is very crowded, like there is one train each day, and all the people need to get in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of people have fled to Romania or Moldova, two of the poorest countries in Europe, yet they've been welcomed with open arms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Slovakia is another destination for those fleeing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This train arrived last night in Ostrava with 400 refugees on board, mostly women and children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And it's not just neighboring countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Nations further west are also taking in or preparing to take in refugees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After three days, this man and his family arrived in France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We left in our pajamas in the middle of the night, cars everywhere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A neighbor, a soldier, told me, it's war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There were bombings everywhere in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN is appealing for $1.7 billion in aid, warning that the crisis could result in over 4 million refugees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thank you very much. but few of them have their engine cars on because there is a lack of fuel you see that station has no gas or fuel at all so many of the refugees abandoned their cars near the road you see them here after that they take the rest of the their trip by foot to the Romanian borders. After they cross, they will go to Romania, some of them they will rest there, but many will go further to other European Union countries. From Ukrainian borders, Vitalii Ekojokari, Euronews, Romania.
